You are here:

SALESFORCE HELP
DOCS
VISUALFORCE B2B COMMERCE
Specify Whether a Buyer Can Modify Addresses on the Checkout Page

Control how much flexibility a buyer has when specifying a shipping and billing address on the Checkout page.

REQUIRED EDITIONS AND USER PERMISSIONS

Salesforce Compatibility

Salesforce Classic (not available in all orgs) and Lightning Experience for Enterprise, Performance, Unlimited, and Developer editions.




B2B Commerce Compatibility

B2B Commerce for Visualforce Winter ’21 (version 4.13)
B2B Commerce for Visualforce Spring ’20 (version 4.12)
B2B Commerce for Visualforce Summer ’19 (version 4.11)
B2B Commerce for Visualforce Spring ’19 (version 4.10)
B2B Commerce for Visualforce Summer ’18 (version 4.9)


USER PERMISSIONS NEEDED
To view page layouts:	View Setup and Configuration
To customize page layouts:	Customize Application
To edit account records:	Edit on accounts

The Checkout page provides the following options for entering an address, for either standard checkout or line-level independence (LLI) checkout:

Standard checkout:
In the User Information section of the Checkout page:
A link that opens a window where a buyer can select an existing billing address from the account's address book (1).
Controls for entering details for a new billing address (2—some fields not shown).
A link that opens a window where a buyer can select an existing shipping address from the account's address book (3).
Controls for entering details for a new shipping address (4—some fields not shown).
LLI checkout:
In the Add New Shipping Group window:
A carousel for selecting a shipping address from the account's address book (5).
Controls for entering details for a new shipping address (6).
NOTE For the billing address in LLI checkout, a buyer specifies details in the Order Payment section of the Checkout page.

You can restrict a buyer from entering any new address details, and require them to select from the account's address book. To enforce this requirement, B2B Commerce provides the following custom fields on the standard account object:

Prevent New Addresses at Checkout
A buyer associated with the account can only select an existing shipping address from the account's address book. The buyer can't enter new shipping address details on the Checkout page.
Prevent New Checkout Billing Addresses
A buyer associated with the account can only select an existing billing address from the account's address book. The buyer can't enter new billing address details on the Checkout page.
TIP You can also specify whether the First Name, Last Name, or Company Name fields display for both the billing and shipping address.
NOTE
When you allow a buyer to enter address details, B2B Commerce creates corresponding contact address records.
If a customer service representative (CSR) user orders on behalf of a buyer, you can specify whether the CSR user owns those created contact address records.

To manage how much access a buyer has for modifying billing or shipping address details on the Checkout page:

Add the custom fields to the account page layout.
Find the page layouts for the standard account object.
In Lightning Experience, click the Object Manager tab in Setup. Select Account, and then scroll to the Page Layouts section.
In Salesforce Classic, enter Account in the Quick Find box in Setup. Select Page Layouts under Accounts.
Click Account Layout.
From Fields, drag Prevent New Addresses at Checkout and Prevent New Checkout Billing Addresses to the Account Detail section in the page layout.
TIP To also prevent editing billing and shipping addresses on the My Account page, add the Prevent Address Book Saves field.
Save your changes.
Edit the accounts whose buyers you want to prevent entering any address details on the Checkout page.
On the Accounts tab in your org, select an account, and click Edit.
To prevent the account's buyers from entering any billing address details, enable Prevent New Checkout Billing Addresses.
To prevent the account's buyers from entering any shipping address details, enable Prevent New Addresses at Checkout.
Save your changes.
TIP When you allow a buyer to enter address details, you can customize the list of countries available in the country picklists.
